flawed_nl_solution:
We know that Josh must be 30 years older than his age when they got married, therefore he is 30 + 22 = <<30+22=52>>52 years old today
If their current combined age is 5 times the age Josh was when they married (22), then their total combined age is 5 * 22 = <<5*22=110>>110 years
That means that Anna must be 110 - 52 = <<110-52=85>>85 years old today
If they married 30 years ago, Anna must have been 85 - 30 = <<85-30=55>>55 years old when they married
#### 55

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 58, not 85. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
